entry.title: Just How Popular Could a Spot Bitcoin ETF Be If Approved by SEC?
entry.summary: The cryptocurrency community has been buzzing with excitement as the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) considers whether to approve a Bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF). This potential crypto milestone begs the question: How popular would a spot Bitcoin ETF be if approved by the SEC? In this essay, we will look at the relevance of a spot Bitcoin ETF, its possible impact on the cryptocurrency market, and the factors that may influence its level of investor popularity. Understanding the Bitcoin ETF Spot A spot Bitcoin ETF is intended to give investors exposure to the underlying asset, Bitcoin, without requiring them to own the cryptocurrency itself. In contrast to futures-based ETFs, which derive their value from Bitcoin futures contracts, a spot Bitcoin ETF woâ€¦

Per an official press release, the company behind the biggest stablecoin in the world, Tether, announced a change in its top executives. The company announced that Paolo Ardoino, its current CTO, will take over the position of CEO starting in December 2023.
Tether Announces Changes In Its Leadership
Tether claims Ardoino made significant contributions to the company and called its leadership â€œvisionaryâ€ in the crypto space. Ardoino will replace Jean Lous van der Velde, the current CEO of the crypto company, but will remain as the CTO at crypto exchange Bitfinex and CSO at Holepunch.
The announcement confirmed that van der Velde will assume a new position as an advisor for Tether. However, van der Velde will remain as the CEO of Bitfinex.
Ardoino has been the CTO of Tether since 2â€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Bulls End a 5-Day Losing Streak
entry.summary:
Bitcoin ended a five-day losing streak on Friday, as the cryptocurrency appears to have found an interim price floor. This comes as traders continued to react to yesterdayâ€™s U.S. inflation report, which remained unchanged at 3.7%. Ethereum also edged marginally higher, following its own recent bear run.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) snapped a five-day winless run on Friday, as markets continued to react to the latest inflation report in the United States.
Following a low of $26,558.32 during Thursdayâ€™s session, BTC/USD climbed to an intraday peak of $26,919.04 earlier today.
Overall, todayâ€™s rebound in price came after BTC collided with the $26,560 level, with bulls using this as a floor, for now.
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
It appears that the longer-term point of support is at $26,000, however with the relative strength index (RSI) failing to move below the 45.00 level, price has yet to hit this zone.
Currently, the index is tracking at 46.41, since failing to breach its floor at 45.00, however bears could attempt to send this lower in the coming days.
Should this level hold, there is a possibility that bitcoin reenters the $27,000 level this weekend.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) was marginally higher today, after it too rebounded from its own support level on Friday.
ETH/USD peaked at $1,553.51 during todayâ€™s session, which follows a bottom at the $1,523.24 mark the day prior.
Yesterdayâ€™s low was the weakest point that ethereum had hit since March 12, when price bottomed out at $1,612.
Ethereum chart by TradingView
The 10-day (red) moving average has continued to extend its downward crossover with its 25-day (blue) counterpart, suggesting upcoming bearish sentiment.
Although the price is now above the floor at $1,535, there is a good chance that this could change in the coming days.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will bulls be able to resist the current downward pressure? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: Nigerian Court Convicts P2P Crypto Trader Accused of Operating a Pig Butchering Scam
entry.summary:
A Nigerian court recently convicted and fined a peer-to-peer (P2P) crypto trader accused of running a pig butchering scam. According to the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, the crypto traderâ€™s activities were â€œcontrary to and punishable under the Cybercrimes (Prohibition etc.) Act, 2015.â€
Offense â€˜Bordering on Cybercrimesâ€™
A Nigerian court recently convicted a peer-to-peer cryptocurrency trader accused by authorities of committing a â€œcomputer related fraud.â€ In his ruling, Justice Nicholas Oweibo of the Federal High Court ruled that the accused Lawrence Success Karinate has to pay a fine equivalent to $257.90 or N200,000.
According to a statement issued by the anti-corruption body, the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC), Karinate faced one charge â€œbordering on cybercrimes.â€ The EFCC, which prosecuted the case, said the crime is in contravention of Section 22(2)(b) of the Cybercrimes (Prohibition etc.) Act, 2015.
The P2P Traderâ€™s Pig Butchering Scam
Detailing how the crypto trader ran what the EFCC calls a pig butchering scam, the anti-corruption bodyâ€™s said:
â€œThat you, Success Lawrence Karinate, sometime in 2023, within the jurisdiction of this Honourable Court, with intent to defraud, fraudulently held out yourself on social media platforms, as a female, bearing the name â€˜Jessie Randallâ€™, a fashion influencer, to unsuspecting members of the public, with intent to gain advantage for yourself and you thereby committed an offence, contrary to and punishable under Section 22(2)(b) of the Cybercrimes (Prohibition etc.) Act, 2015.â€
Karinate, who pleaded guilty to the charge, was arrested by EFCC operatives in the Lekki area of Lagos State on May 26, 2023. At the time of his arrest, the operatives recovered a mobile phone which the crypto trader used to perpetrate the scam. According to the EFCC he admitted to gaining $2,000 from the scam.
What are your thoughts on this story? Let us know what you think in the comments section below.

entry.title: Ripple CTO vs. Cardano CEO: SECâ€™s Favoritism For ETH Is â€˜Corruptionâ€™
entry.summary:
In the latest clash of crypto heavyweights, Ripple CTO David Schwartz has refuted Cardano founder and IOG CEO Charles Hoskinsonâ€™s comments on the ongoing debate surrounding the alleged preferential treatment Ethereum received from the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The back-and-forth revolves around the so-called â€œETH Gateâ€ theory, which questions the SECâ€™s decision-making process regarding Ethereumâ€™s regulatory status.
Ripple CTO And Cardano Founder Clash Over ETH Gate
Earlier this week, in an â€œasked me anythingâ€ (AMA), Charles Hoskinson (one of the eight former Ethereum founders) voiced his perspective on the topic, stating: â€œItâ€™s certainly a value getting these Hinman emails and these other things because they can perhaps expose the thought process the SEC has and you â€¦

entry.title: Madeiran President Announces Launch of Bitcoin Business Hub To Foster Innovation
entry.summary:
Today on day two of Bitcoin Amsterdam 2023, the President of MadeiraÂ Miguel Albuquerque,Â alongside Prince Filip of Serbia in a fireside chat, announced the creation of a Bitcoin business hub in the region to foster innovation.Â "Last night you showed me the picture of what will be the new Bitcoin business hub," said Prince Filip. "The association has been created to develop the development of technology and Bitcoin, and all the connections and partnerships you can have. It started with some guys in Madeira who work really hard, and it's open to everyone who wants to collaborate," responded President Albuquerque. Prince Filip then went on to tell the president that he's very happy the region of Madeira is embracing Bitcoin, calling it "a technology for the future" and anÂ "open, secure protocol akin to the internet."Â Filip, a staunch Bitcoin advocate and CSO at Jan31, has been helping educate lawmakers around the world on the benefits of nation state Bitcoin adoption.
"We're changing our economic [base] for technological companies, high tech, artificial intelligence, and Bitcoin of course," said the Madeiran president. "Everything that is connected with Bitcoin is welcome in Madeira." At The Bitcoin 2022 conference in Miami, it was announced that Madeira was embracing Bitcoin and thatÂ BTC investors will pay no personal income taxes in the region. "I believe in the future and I believe in Bitcoin,â€ said President Albuquerque last year. "Individuals in Madeira that buy and sell bitcoin ... don't pay taxes. Theyâ€™re not subject to personal income taxes.â€ Earlier this year, a delegation of Bitcoiners visited Madeira toÂ discussÂ Bitcoin with the PresidentÂ Albuquerque, and to see the progress of its adoption across the region, which can be viewed below.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Trial: Defenseâ€™s Lukewarm Examination Fails To Exonerate FTX Founder
entry.summary:
Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) and his lawyers do not seem to have made any headways in their defense, as the second week of the defendantâ€™s trial ends on October 13. The highlight of how their case has gone so far was again on display when Mark Cohen stepped forward to cross-examine Caroline Ellison on October 12.Â
FTX Founderâ€™s Lawyers Fail To Establish Anything On Cross-Examination
During cross-examination, the first thing Cohen did was ask Ellison if SBF was correct about some of the things he had told her in a bid to establish that Sam Bankman-Fried wasnâ€™t wrong about some of the decisions he made. However, the prosecution rebutted on the grounds of relevance. Ellison still proceeded to answer the question but in a non-definite way.Â
After that, Cohen seemed to lose the plot as he begaâ€¦

entry.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain
entry.summary: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. He explained how the new dYdX chain will allow validators to run order books in memory, enabling decentralized order matching at scale. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

entry.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.

entry.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities
entry.summary: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: â€œIf you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,â€ he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. â€œThat's something that's caused a lot of issues.â€

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. AndrÃ© Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by AndrÃ© Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
